intro: Teucrium thieleanum, commonly known as the Thieleanum germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually violet or purple, appearing in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Teucrium thieleanum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
